summary: An internal FBI email from August 6, 2019, discussing plans for drafting and executing a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email coordinates travel and logistics for FBI personnel from the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad to conduct a multi-day search.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The search warrant affidavit is being drafted for his private island off St. Thomas.

events.title: Expected warrant swearing
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the warrant expected to be sworn out on Friday in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to St. Thomas
events.description: FBI personnel plan to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant.

events.title: Planned search of Epstein's island
events.description: The search, managed by the Evidence Response Team (ERT), is expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned FBI travel home
events.description: Thursday is scheduled as the travel day home for FBI personnel after the search.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas in August 2019.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) was involved in planning and executing the search.
The search was expected to be a multi-day operation managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).
The email indicates coordinated travel plans using an FBI Q400 plane for personnel to travel to and from St. Thomas.
The planning was tentative as of August 6, 2019, with personnel asked to confirm availability.
